MainClaim.text: "The demise of classical neo-Kantianism between the wars had at least as much to do with institutional

Neo-Kantianism as Scapegoat.text: "Neo-Kantianism became the'scapegoat' for many of the perceived problems in imperial and Weimar culture after World War I."

Affinities between neo-Kantianism and th.text: "Neo-Kantianism had affinities with the interwar Zeitgeist

Failure of neo-Kantianism.text: "Despite its apparent affinities with the interwar Zeitgeist

Critique of Kant.text: "Some of the best-known criticisms of Kant made by Lukacs do not apply very well to Kant himself

s own views on limits of knowledge.text: "Kant repeatedly expresses his awareness of the limits of theoretical knowledge and his frustration with that fact."

s moral philosophy.text: "Lukacs' criticism of Kant's moral philosophy is not a reconstruction of the historical Kant or an evaluation of relevant philosophical problems."

Neo-Kantian readings of Kant.text: "The perceived unattractiveness of prominent neo-Kantian readings of Kant led to a renewed interest in a more painstaking historical and rational reconstruction of Kant's own views."

Legacy of Kant.text: "The legacy of Kant became both so contested and so crucial that a new generation of scholars saw the need for yet another movement back to Kant."

New generation of scholars.text: "A new generation of scholars founded the vibrant traditions of historical Kant scholarship that are now flourishing across both Europe and the Americas."
